Also reproduced with Solaris client, Windows target
This is a must-fix since it makes using windows-dstore from unix impossible.

Fixed this myself in PathUtility.java since it was my code...
String.replaceAll(regex,replacement) needs to quote \ in replacement as well,
since \1 is short for replacing regex matched groups.
*** Bug 161936 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
